title: Borrow checking fails in case a closure appears in a const expression

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The following code causes compiler panics due to the first line without which the issue isn't reproducible. Calling the function outside of a constant context emits the right compiler errors. ### Code ```Rust const CACHE: &[u32] = &const_sort(&[2, 3, 1], |a, b| a < b); // that line is a failure reason const fn const_sort(v: &[u32; N], mut is_less: F) -> [u32; N] where F: FnMut(&u32, &u32) -> bool, { let mut r = [0; N]; let mut i = 0; while i < N { r[i] = v[i]; i += 1; } let mut i = 1; while i < N { if is_less(&r[i], &r[i - 1]) { let tmp = r[i]; r[i] = r[i - 1]; let mut j = i - 1; while j > 0 && is_less(&tmp, &r[j - 1]) { r[j] = r[j - 1]; j -= 1; } r[j] = tmp; } i += 1; } r } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value', compiler/rustc_mir/src/borrow_check/region_infer/mod.rs:2136:35 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.52.0-nightly (9778068cb 2021-02-07) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [mir_borrowck] borrow-checking `CACHE` #1 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: could not compile `playground` ```
Backtrace
